properties.name: !data
properties.doc: The data object bound to this chart control.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Chart type. See the Plotly chart type documentation for details.

properties.name: mode
properties.doc: Chart mode. See the Plotly chart mode documentation for details.

properties.name: x
properties.doc: Column name for the x axis. Synonym for lon.

properties.name: y
properties.doc: Column name for the y axis. Synonym for lat.

properties.name: z
properties.doc: Column name for the z axis.

properties.name: lon
properties.doc: Column name for the longitude value. Synonym for x.

properties.name: lat
properties.doc: Column name for the latitude value. Synonym for y.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: Column name for the text associated to the point for the indicated trace. This is meaningful only when _mode_ has the text option.

properties.name: base
properties.doc: Column name for the base value. Used in bar charts only. See the Plotly bar chart base documentation for details."

properties.name: title
properties.doc: The title of this chart control.

properties.name: render
properties.doc: If True, this chart is visible on the page.

properties.name: on_range_change
properties.doc:
Callback function called when the visible part of the x axis changes. The function receives four parameters:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the chart control.
  • action (optional[str]): the name of the action that provoked the change.
  • payload (dict[str, any]): the full details on this callback's invocation, as emitted by plotly.

properties.name: columns
properties.doc:
List of column names
  • str: ;-separated list of column names
  • List[str]: list of names
  • dict: {"col_name": {format: "format", index: 1}} if index is specified, it represents the display order of the columns. If not, the list order defines the index

properties.name: label
properties.doc:
The label for the indicated trace.
This is used when the mouse hovers over a trace.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: The name of the indicated trace.

properties.name: selected
properties.doc: List of the selected point indices.

properties.name: color
properties.doc: The color of the indicated trace (or a column name for scattered).

properties.name: selected_color
properties.doc: The color of the selected points for the indicated trace.

properties.name: marker
properties.doc: The type of markers used for the indicated trace. See marker for details. Color and size can be column name.

properties.name: line
properties.doc: The configuration of the line used for the indicated trace. See line for details. If the value is a string, it must be a dash type or pattern (see dash style of lines for details).

properties.name: selected_marker
properties.doc:
The type of markers used for selected points in the indicated trace.
See <a href="https://plotly.com/javascript/reference/scatter/#scatter-selected-marker">selected marker for details.

properties.name: layout
properties.doc: The plotly.js compatible layout object.

properties.name: plot_config
properties.doc: The plotly.js compatible configuration options object.

properties.name: options
properties.doc: The plotly.js compatible data object where dynamic data will be overridden..

properties.name: orientation
properties.doc: The orientation of the indicated trace.

properties.name: text_anchor
properties.doc: Position of the text relative to the point. Valid values are: top, bottom, left, and right.

properties.name: xaxis
properties.doc: The x axis identifier for the indicated trace.

properties.name: yaxis
properties.doc: The y axis identifier for the indicated trace.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of this element.
